abstract.p: Selling arm of South Africa's De Beers Consolidated Mines Ltd, world's leading miner and purveyor of diamonds, reports 44 percent increase in sales for first half of 2000, to $3.5 billion (S)

block.p: The selling arm of South Africa's De Beers Consolidated Mines Ltd., the world's leading miner and purveyor of diamonds, reported a 44 percent increase in sales for the first half of 2000, to $3.5 billion. Strong economic growth in the United States, the biggest market for precious stones, was a major contributor to the increase. De Beers, which has long dominated the diamond industry, is facing increased competition and new attention to the role diamonds play in driving armed conflicts, particularly in Africa.
